content.description: Fun well protected face climb. Crux‘s are at the second / third bolts, thin face moves, and final bolt at top opposite rock of repel ring (V Groove)
content.protection: 6 bolts plus standard rack.   Repel rings at the top.
content.location: 25‘ Right of the big left to right diagonal corner/crack system (south yellow wall) / 15‘ left of Sam Stone route.

climbs.name: Spanish Pipedream
climbs.fa: John Halupowski, John Rice, and Ben Miller 9/18/20

content.description: Some good moves. Start at the toe of the slab and go straight up the center. Crux is passing the first bolt. If you enter from or use the sides of the slab it goes at 5.6.John Prine 1946-2020"I knew that topless lady, had something up her sleeve"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DWmG9wCE440&list=RDDWmG9wCE440&start_radio=1
content.protection: 2 bolts and a very small cam. 2 SS rap ring anchor.
content.location: The first climb you come to. About 10' off the ski trail.

climbs.name: Sam Stone
climbs.fa: John Halupowski, Ben Miller, and John Rice  8/31/20

content.description: Great horizontal cracks get you past a small roof and a short steep face to the top of a block. Easier climbing leads to a view and belay ledge.Go up a short right trending ramp to clip a bolt under the roof. Reach around the roof to clip another bolt. Pull the roof/crux and up a short steep face using 'thank you' horizontal cracks to the top of a large block (great cam placements at the bottom and top of the block). 2 more bolts up a moderate face brings you to the anchor/view. A hidden cam placement was unearthed after the bolts went in so the finish is over protected.John Prine was a great singer/songwriter. He passed from COVID19 in April 2020. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rtrALjg0-xQ
content.protection: 4 bolts and small/med cams. SS rap anchors.
content.location: Starts in the center of the right wall under an obvious roof.

content.description: Climb a block that leads up onto a ledge at the north side of the C Lot area. There is a face above, broken up by two horizontal/diagonal cracks running across it.  A bolt protects a tricky move to gain the lowest crack.  Climb through the cracks to the upper section, also protected by a second bolt for the top out moves.  Belay/rappel from rap rings.
content.protection: Standard rack for the middle. Two bolts protect the bottom and the top sections.  Two rappel rings at the top.
content.location: Easily seen from Connie's Way Ski Trail, about 30 feet off  the trail.  A conspicuous detached rock leans against the cliff.  Start here.

content.description: Pretty little face climb with a sting in the tail.
content.location: Left most climb at the crag

content.description: C Lot Crag is an amphitheater formed by a steep yellow wall on the left (south), that makes a big corner where it abuts a face of lower angled rock.  Like the other crags around it, it offers coarse, highly featured rock.  It is on the west (uphill) side of Connie's Way Ski Trail.  Connie's Crag is two hundred feet north, farther up  the trail.  This crag is named after a popular spring skiing destination across the street at Wildcat.
